Comments_List:
I learned about the algebraic numbers, the ring of integers of a number field, discriminant of a number field, integral basis, finiteness of the class group, Dirichlet's unit theorem, Witt vectors, p-adic numbers and the zeta function in this course. 
I realized that linear algebra and commutative algebra are very helpful tools in the development and understanding of algebraic number theory.

The content of this course is very enlightening and enriching for students who have just taken courses in graduate algebra. 
And the interaction of algebra and analysis is also inspiring.

I particularly the emphasis on connections to other parts of mathematics, both in the lectures and the project and homeworks. I think the course would have been improved by having more homework assignments earlier in the course, and by including problems requiring us to perform computations on specific instances of general results we learned in lecture.

This course is definitely worthwhile to take for students of mathematics. 
It illustrates the power and beauty of algebra, and its interactions with analysis.
Would strongly recommend this one, (for undergrads: after taking the rest of the undergraduate sequence, esp. algebra).
Goncharov is fantastic, he gives great motivation and insight into what is really going on.
